en: Administration Building for Agricultural Experiment Station

Butler Hall was erected in 1918 at a cost of $90,000. This building was originally designed to house the administrative offices of the Agricultural Experiment Station. It was renamed in the 1980s to honor Eugene Butler, former editor of Progressive Farmer and a voice for policies supporting rural farming in Texas.
